cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. July 1942.SECRET. Copy Me.W.M. (42)95th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 95 (42).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Friday, July 24, 1942, at 5 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P.,Secretary of State for DominionAffairs.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The following were also present:The Right Hon. S. M. Bruce,Accredited Representative of theGovernment of the Commonwealthof Australia. *The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.Admiral of the Fleet Sir dudley pound, First Sea Lord and Chief ofNaval Staff.General Sir Alan Brooke, Chief of theImperial General Staff.The Right Hon. Sir James Grigg,M.P., Secretary of State for War.The Hon. Sir Alexander Cadogan,Permanent Under-Secretary of Statefor Foreign Affairs.Air Chief Marshal Sir Charles F. A.Portal, Chief of the Air Staff.Vice-Admiral Lord Louis Mount-batten, Chief of Combined Opera-tions.Secretariat.Sir Edward Bridges.Major-General Sir Hastings Ismay.Contents.minute no. Subject.1 Naval, Military and Air Operations2 Supplies to Russia - ........3 Future Operations ........Page152152152* [24154] Military 1. The War Cabinet were given^latest information as toand Air the progress of operations in the Middle East.Operations.(Previous ,Reference:W.M. (42) 92nd--Conclusions,Minute 1.)Supplies toRussia.(previous reference:W.M. (42) 86thConclusions,Minute 1.)2. The War Cabinet were informed of the position in thismatter, and had a discussion, which is recorded in the Secretary'standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.future operations.(previous reference:W.M. (42) 94thConclusions.)3. The War Cabinet had a discussion on future operations,which is recorded in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet conclusions.Great George Street, S.W. 1,July 24, 1942.
